title: Immunoglobulin M regulates airway hyperresponsiveness independent of T helper 2 allergic inflammation.
abstract: Allergic asthma is a disease driven by T helper 2 (Th2) cells, eosinophilia, airway hyperresponsiveness (AHR), and IgE-secreting B cells. Asthma is largely controlled by corticosteroids and Î²
